summary: Little ramble about Dany’s arrival at Dragonstone
title: Little ramble about Dany’s arrival at Dragonstone
body:
You know what bugged me about  when Dany came to Dragonstone, is the lack of any mention of any family heirlooms or the tomb where the ashes of the deceased are kept.   Like where’s the scene where Dany  holds the urn containing her mother Rhaella’s ashes? 

 Where’s the scene were she’s looking at the display of all the crowns of the Taragayen Kings and Queens and taking note of the missing ones, like Aegon I’s  Jaehaerys I’s and her own mothers? (And possibly the crown Aegon III and Egg later wore, since we don’t know if it was destroyed during the tragedy at Summerhall.   Or where she takes a look at her the suit of armor Rhaegar wore, or the mace of Maekar I?

Dany’s arrival at Dragonstone is supposed to be the climax of her journey.  She’s finally back at her family home and returned to the country she was born in.  (Very sick of people in the ASOIF/GOT fandom calling Dany a foreign Queen, she’s as much a westerosi as Jon Snow, or Sansa or Brienne)     

Dany can  finally take in the rich and lengthy history of her House, this scene of her arrival is to showcase she’s only a few steps from becoming the Queen Westeros needs her to be,  and like the scene of the Stark banners flying at Winterfell after the Battle of the Bastards is supposed to by a triumphant scene

But all we get is Dany walking the beach,  looking at the throne, and then making her way to  the painted table.  The scene failed at trying to  convey the emotions it wanted us to feel.   

Maybe it’s just me, but I felt rather let down by this scene.

summary: please do not hate Jon Snow either. I love him just as much as I love Daenerys and I hate what this horrible writing has done to...
body: please do not hate Jon Snow either. I love him just as much as I love Daenerys and I hate what this horrible writing has done to a strong character. If the leaks are true, do not hate him for it. We know who he is and no writing will change that. We know Jon loves Dany very much and it’s a shame they wrote him as a side character this season. Jon and Daenerys did not get a future and a chance at happiness as we hoped, but again, we know these characters better than D & D.

summary: You know what I still don’t understand? If everyone that was saying about dark/mad Dany was correct; why don’t go there in the...
body:
You know what I still don’t understand? If everyone that was saying about dark/mad Dany was correct; why don’t go there in the last season? Why don’t make her go direct to KingsLanding with all her force be completely the conqueror she was always suppose to be? Why make her lost two of her children, three of her allies; her best friend and a man that show her love and respect?

The destruction of kings landing in 8x05 could happen easily with her three dragons and both armies still strong. And then you could make everyone in Westeros be afraid of her power and her iron hand.

Why don’t go there? Why like this?

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: tried my hand at illustrating the prophecies dany gets at the house of the undying... not claiming these are the most correct, i...
caption:
tried my hand at illustrating the prophecies dany gets at the house of the undying… not claiming these are the most correct, i was just having fun exploring possibilities (upcoming episode might disprove all of it). Explanations under the cut:

- since the prophecies are in future tense, i only included plot points that she finds out about after hearing the prophecies.

- The idea is that all sets of three happen after each other - so for example first dany lights a fire for life, then later one for death, then one for love. Same for the other sets.

- my theory is that every word represents one person, so ‘love’ would always refer to the same person and thus the same monumentous upcoming event. It has a spooky vibe, whatever the final event is must be so important that dany is told about it thrice.

- since by my reasoning the fire for life happens after dany hears the prophecy, i chose her escaping the house of the undying.

- the treasons probably have my weakest reasoning - varys is for blood because if we believe f!aegon and varys are secret blackfyres, then varys and illyrio have basically used viserys and dany in order to forward the agenda of soemeone they’re blood related to (since illyrio pretended to support viserys and dany). Varys is also a candidate for the “perfumed seneschal”, so he will probably have an impact on dany’s story. Tyrion is the treason for gold because he’s an important character, is connected to gold (casterly rock, his sigil, the haircolor of his family), and is on a downward spiral during aDwD; but idk what he would do to betray dany.

- no idea what the event involving jon would be, but it seems they are fated to intersect and fall in love, and if he is the mount to love he needs to be the rest as well.

But as i said, these are just guesses and just as valid as other theories

Varys is also a candidate for the “perfumed seneschal”, so he will probably have an impact on dany’s story. Tyrion is the treason for gold because he’s an important character, is connected to gold (casterly rock, his sigil, the haircolor of his family), and is on a downward spiral during aDwD; but idk what he would do to betray dany.

- no idea what the event involving jon would be, but it seems they are fated to intersect and fall in love, and if he is the mount to love he needs to be the rest as well.

But as i said, these are just guesses and just as valid as other theories
trail.content_abstract: tried my hand at illustrating the prophecies dany gets at the house of the undying… not claiming these are the most correct, i was just having fun exploring possibilities (upcoming episode might disprove all of it). Explanations under the cut:
